item.title: Nanny Thanksgiving (2017)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Levenbook
item.description: It is time to start a new tradition: Nanny Thanksgiving, a friendsgiving of sorts. Round up your left overs and bring them potluck style to the home of a volunteer member nanny host on the Sunday after Thanksgiving, from 2 pm until whenever the host deems appropriate and once again revel in the giving […]
item.content:encoded:
It is time to start a new tradition: Nanny Thanksgiving, a friendsgiving of sorts. Round up your left overs and bring them potluck style to the home of a volunteer member nanny host on the Sunday after Thanksgiving, from 2 pm until whenever the host deems appropriate and once again revel in the giving of thanks: for our careers, our profession, and our boots-on-the-ground local professional network.

We are seeking volunteer hosts from all the regions we serve: Triangle, Triad, Wilmington, Charlotte, Asheville, and Boone. If you are interested in being a volunteer host (all you have to do is provide a space, some plates and forks, and a smile), contact webmaster@ncpan.org. We are thankful to you and will provide you with a little something as our way of saying thanks for being an event host. Regions crossed off the list have already found hosts.

Look below for the details for your region as well as the RSVP information, should any exist.

Triangle Region

Location: Chapel Hill, North Carolina

RSVP:Â On Facebook or by emailing volunteer host Jen.

Spread the Word

Share the image at the top of this post on any and all social media you have access to, and provide details of your local regions Nanny Thanksgiving. Also, invite people to the Facebook events for the different regions and/or share those events in your local area’s nanny facebook groups.
